params._baseRateRAY: Interest rate at 0% utilization, in RAY format
params._breakpointRAY: Utilization percentage where the function slope increases
params._maxRateRAY: Interest rate at 100% utilizatoin, in RAY format
params._optimalRateRAY: Interest rate at breakpoint, in RAY format

getInterestRate(uint256,uint256,uint256,.details: Returns the current interest rate in RAY format, based on assumed (total) and available liquidity

params.assumedLiquidity: Total liquidity in the pool, including available and borrowed funds

breakpointRAY().notice: The slope of the function should increase significantly         after the breakpoint. This should make borrowing up to         the breakpoint the optimal strategy, and discourages         fully draining the pool

constructor.notice: Since the function's parameter space is [0%; 100%] and the interest rate function         is a piecewise linear function of pool utilization, these 4 parameters fully define         the interest model

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "Base Rate Ray exceeds Optimal Rate Ray"

arguments.value: Base Rate Ray exceeds Optimal Rate Ray

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "Base Rate Ray exceeds Optimal Rate Ray"

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "Optimal rate Ray exceeds Max Rate Ray"

arguments.value: Optimal rate Ray exceeds Max Rate Ray

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "Optimal rate Ray exceeds Max Rate Ray"
